text: ਇਸੁ ਤਨ ਮਨ ਮਧੇ ਮਦਨ ਚੋਰ ॥
section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Within the body and mind are thieves like sexual desire,

transliteration.text: is tan man madhē madan chōr .

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. This Raag encourages the mind to brush away its selfishness, just like spring-cleaning removes all the cobwebs and creates a fresh start. There are feelings of hope and expectation of a new beginning and the start of a new cycle. However, these emotions are not dependent on the physical change of the season, but are an encouragement of an internal effort to change.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਜਿਨਿ ਗਿਆਨ ਰਤਨੁ ਹਿਰਿ ਲੀਨ ਮੋਰ ॥
section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: which has stolen my jewel of spiritual wisdom.

transliteration.text: jin giān ratan hir līn mōr .

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. This Raag encourages the mind to brush away its selfishness, just like spring-cleaning removes all the cobwebs and creates a fresh start. section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am a poor orphan, O God; unto whom should I complain?

text: ਕੋ ਕੋ ਨ ਬਿਗੂਤੋ ਮੈ ਕੋ ਆਹਿ ॥੧॥
section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Who has not been ruined by sexual desire? What am I? ||1||

transliteration.text: kō kō n bigūtō mai kō āh .1.

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. This Raag encourages the mind to brush away its selfishness, just like spring-cleaning removes all the cobwebs and creates a fresh start. There are feelings of hope and expectation of a new beginning and the start of a new cycle. text: ਮਾਧਉ ਦਾਰੁਨ ਦੁਖੁ ਸਹਿਓ ਨ ਜਾਇ ॥
section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Lord, I cannot endure this agonizing pain.

transliteration.text: mādhau dārun dukh sahiō n jāi .

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. This Raag encourages the mind to brush away its selfishness, just like spring-cleaning removes all the cobwebs and creates a fresh start. text: ਮੇਰੋ ਚਪਲ ਬੁਧਿ ਸਿਉ ਕਹਾ ਬਸਾਇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: What power does my fickle mind have against it? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: mērō chapal budh siu kahā basāi .1. rahāu .

text: ਪ੍ਰਭ ਦੀਨਾ ਨਾਥ ਦੁਖੁ ਕਹਉ ਕਾਹਿ ॥
section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O God, Master of the meek, unto whom should I tell my pains?

transliteration.text: prabh dīnā nāth dukh kahau kāh .

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. This Raag encourages the mind to brush away its selfishness, just like spring-cleaning removes all the cobwebs and creates a fresh start. There are feelings of hope and expectation of a new beginning and the start of a new cycle. text: ਮੋਰੋ ਜਨਮ ਮਰਨ ਦੁਖੁ ਆਥਿ ਧੀਰ ॥
section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Please rid me of the pains of birth and death, and bless me with peace.

transliteration.text: mōrō janam maran dukh āth dhīr .

melody.description: Basant denotes the changing of the season and the newness of spring. This Raag encourages the mind to brush away its selfishness, just like spring-cleaning removes all the cobwebs and creates a fresh start. section: Basant - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Kabeer utters the Glorious Praises of God, the Ocean of peace. ||3||5||
